div.class: inner col col24 first last id739bbe24-0b75-44a4-a585-c4a4933972a3
inner col col24 first last id3187f4cd-8f36-4000-a3be-5cb82bf42caf

li.br:
Get a free library card for digital checkouts for books, audiobooks and magazines, digital resources.
Every Tuesday and Wednesday morning at 10:30 am the library is hosting a virtual Storytime on Facebook.

ul.li:
Resources for Adults 65+ (PDF)
A list for seniors of Powhatan businesses and services to help see them through the pandemic.

li.br: The Extension Office is offering free online courses on personal finance, financial volunteer training and Food Handler ServSafe.
See what local restaurants are open and offering delivery or take out.
Volunteer transportation to Powhatan seniors, age 60+ , who are unable to drive themselves for basic needs or for delivery of necessities.
A free nonprofit website that connects seniors to local resources: financial help, housing and food assistance, etc.
Offering free hand sanitizer. Please consider making a donation for their service.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id46bf57d7-49dd-41e9-ade7-61cc8e88da9e

div.p: The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and. Economic Security (CARES) Act is intended to assist individuals, families and businesses through the COVID-19 pandemic.

li.a: Full text of the CARES Act
FAQ on the Federal Coronavirus Relief Law (CARES Act)
Coronavirus and Forbearance Info for Students, Borrowers, and Parents
CARES Act Will Support Internet Connectivity for Remote Education, Healthcare, and Work

div.class: inner col col24 first last id3fabfe8a-0592-48b8-b9f3-20a75aecf1ea

li.a: Coronavirus Pandemic Individual Financial Assistance: Rebates and Unemployment
li.br: FAQ and resources for COVID-19 rebates and unemployment compensation.

ul.li:
Frequently Asked Questions from Workers Regarding COVID-19 (PDF)
Guidance for workers on how to navigate this public health crisis to keep their families both healthy and financially stable.

li.br: Career assistance for job seekers, employment services for veterans, as well as other programs designed to assist with employment.

ul.li:
Unemployment in Virginia FAQ (PDF)
A Library of Virginia guide and resource on applying for unemployment.

li.br: A Virginia Career Works resource of businesses currently hiring.
An online source to connect with potential employers, search for jobs and find training opportunities.

div.class: inner col col24 first last ida6b7b484-0719-4790-a190-086cbeaa9930

li.a: Powhatan County Economic Development Business Resources
li.br: The Economic Development department provides support and resources to local businesses.

ul.li:
Small Business Owner’s Guide to the CARES Act (PDF)
New resources available for small businesses, as well as certain nonprofits and other employers.

Applying for SBA Disaster Loans (Webinar)
Free webinars by the Small Business Administration’s Richmond District Office.

li.br: A financial reprieve to small businesses during the COVID-19 pandemic.
A loan through the U.S. Small Business Administration for businesses to keep their workforce employed.

li.a: Economic Injury Disaster Loan Emergency Advance
li.br: Provides up to $10,000 of economic relief to businesses that are currently experiencing temporary difficulties.
Allows small businesses who currently have a business relationship with an SBA Express Lender to access up to $25,000 quickly.
A fully refundable tax credit for eligible employers equal to 50 percent of qualified wages that employers pay their employees.
A non-profit funded by the SBA that offers free confidential business counseling via phone, email and a variety of video and chat services.

li.a: CDC Guidance for Businesses and Employers to Plan and Respond to COVID-19
li.br: Interim guidance may help prevent workplace exposures to COVID-19 in non-healthcare settings.

li.a: CDC Guide to Cleaning and Disinfecting Your Facility
li.br: Everyday steps, steps when someone is sick, and considerations for employers.

li.a: OSHA Guidance on Preparing Workplaces for COVID-19
li.br: Planning guidance for COVID-19 based on traditional infection prevention and industrial hygiene practices.

div.class: inner col col24 first last idb628136f-6ca6-4291-b366-15f840c658f4

ul.li: The IRS provides free online filing options based on your income.
The deadlines to file and pay federal income taxes have been extended to July 15, 2020.
Late payment penalties will not be charged if state tax payments are made by June 1, 2020.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id6c8f0acd-8b24-4aad-a0af-2742510ecb49

ul.li: Eligible taxpayers who have filed tax returns for 2018 or 2019 will automatically receive an economic impact payment of up to $1,200 for individuals, or $2,400 for married couples and up to $500 for each qualifying child.
Some taxpayers who typically do not file returns will need to submit a simple tax return to receive the economic impact payment.
The vast majority of people do not need to take any action. The IRS will calculate and automatically send the economic impact payment to those eligible.

li.br: Check on the status of your Economic Impact Payment.

br.br: See the IRS’s What You Need to Know Q&A for information about the payments and eligibility.

div.class: inner col col24 first last idae72f384-1229-4eee-b554-016ec9071631

li.br: Where to donate safety goggles, surgical/N95 masks and face shields to healthcare workers.

div.p: Beginning April 3, 2020 the CDC updated their guidelines on cloth face masks and recommended the public wear a cloth face covering in public settings where social distancing is difficult to maintain.

li.a: CDC Guide on How to Make, Use and Clean a Cloth Mask

ul.li: U.S. Surgeon General on How to Make a Face Mask (Video)

div.p: JOANN Fabrics is accepting homemade cloth face mask donations. Customers are able to pick up a face mask kit at any open store, free of charge, to create masks to donate to healthcare systems and organizations in need.

li.a: JOANN Fabrics Guides to Creating Cloth Masks

div.class: inner col col12 first last id2b74ee0d-57ee-4eec-8689-c959cb861876

li.a: National Alliance on Mental Illness’s Resource & Information Guide

ul.li: Mental Health & Psychosocial Considerations during COVID-19 (WHO)

li.a: Mental Health America’s COVID-19 Information & Resources

li.br: Call 1-800-985-5990 or text TalkWithUs to 66746
Call 1-800-273-8255. Veterans press 1 to reach specialized support
Text HOME to 741741

ul.li:
The Trevor Project Lifeline (LGBTQ Youth)
Call 1-866-488-7386 or text START to 678678

li.a: Family Violence and Sexual Assault Hotline

ul.li:
VA Coronavirus Updates (Video)
Governor Ralph Northam provides live updates every Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 2:00PM.

li.a: Virginia’s Actions & Support During the COVID-19 Pandemic
Virginia Department of Health COVID-19 Information
Estimates of Outbreak Peak in Virginia
How VA Police Will Address Stay-at-Home Violations
